definition: to beat the drum and sound the gong (idiom); fig. to order an advance or retreat/to egg people on or to call them back
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
lit. order like a mountain/a military order is inviolable/strict discipline
to beat the drum and sound the gong (idiom); fig. to order an advance or retreat/to egg people on or to call them back
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
to sleep on one's armor with a spear as a pillow (idiom)/to keep ready for battle at all times
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
